document.docAuthor: Barbero, Enrico, Palestrini, Claudia & Roggero, Angela
document.masterDocTitle: Tibiodrepanus tagliaferrii — a new Afrotropical Drepanocerina species (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Oniticellini), with notes on phylogeny and distribution of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Tibiodrepanus tagliaferrii — a new Afrotropical Drepanocerina species (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Oniticellini), with notes on phylogeny and distribution of the genus

bibRefCitation.author: Wiedemann
bibRefCitation.refString: Wiedemann, C. R. W. (1823) Zweihundert neue Kafer von Java, Bengalen und den Vorgebirgen der Gutten Hoffnung. Zoologisches Magazin, 4, 107 - 183.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : 3 , “mus. Westerm.”, “ Type . Bengal.
Juli 1808
. Setosus Wied”. ( ZMUC ).

Additional material examined. Here we have listed about
400 specimens
of
T. setosus
that were examined in the present work. We excluded only the specimens with a label that was considered too generic (see remarks for further information). The number of individuals for each locality is given within brackets.

Diagnosis. The species can be easily separated from the other Oriental species due to the surface of the head shiny and deeply punctate, and the metasternal disc flat.
Distribution. Pakistan , India , Buthan, Nepal , Sri Lanka , China , Burma , Laos , Thailand , Vietnam , Philippines , Indonesia .

Remarks. The species was described by
Wiedemann ( 1823 )
in the genus
Copris
, and was then transferred to the genus
Ixodina
by
Motschulsky ( 1863 : 459 , as
Ixodina setosa
)
. Soon afterwards it was transferred to the genus
Drepanocerus
by
Harold ( 1869 )
. Recently,
Krikken ( 2009 )
included it in the genus
Tibiodrepanus
. Materials with localities that were too generic were not included in the distribution list (e.g., one specimen labeled from “ India ” ( MTD ) or thirty specimens from “ Ceylon ”, various museums). Specimens from various collections did not have the locality labels, thus were not included here.
